Section One: I discussed the matters upon which the disagreement in Destiny revolves, and the cause of that disagreement.

Chapter One
Section One: Definition of Qada and Qadar Linguistically and Religiously

Qadar (Destiny) Linguistically: With a Fatha on the Qaf and open or sukoon on the Dal, it means judgment and ruling. It is what Allah Almighty destines of judgment and rules regarding matters. Allah Almighty said: {Indeed, We sent it down during the Night of Decree (1) And what} [Al-Qadr: 1], meaning judgment (1). Ibn Faris said: Qaf, Dal, and Ra form a sound root indicating the limit of a thing, its essence, and its end. And 'Qadartu ash-shay' aqdiruhu wa aqduruhu' - with sukoon on the Qaf and kasra or damma on the Dal - comes from Tadir (estimation) (2). In Al-Qamus, Al-Qadar (with movement): Judgment, ruling, and the measure of a thing. And Al-Taqdir: Reflection and thinking in settling a matter (3).

Al-Qada (Decree) Linguistically: Separation and judgment. Its origin is cutting and separation. Qada' of a thing means perfecting it, executing it, and finishing it, so it comes with the meaning of creation. Al-Zuhri said: Al-Qada in language has meanings that return to the completion and perfection of a thing. Everything whose work is perfected, completed, sealed, fulfilled, obligated, made known, executed, or passed, has been 'Qudiya' (Decreed). All these meanings have appeared in the Hadith (4).
Qada and Qadar are two inseparable matters; one does not detach from the other, because one of them is like the foundation, which is Qadar, and the other is like the building, which is Qada. So whoever seeks to separate them seeks to demolish the building and tear it down (5).

Meaning of Qada and Qadar Religiously: It is that Allah Almighty knew all things before their existence, wrote them with Him, willed what existed of them, and created what He intended to create (6).

Another definition: It is the decisive belief that every good and evil is by Allah's decree and destiny, and that He does what He wills. Nothing happens in His dominion except by His will, and nothing exits His volition. There is nothing in the world that exits His estimation, nor issues except from His management. There is no escape for anyone from destiny, nor can anyone exceed what was written in the Preserved Tablet. And [it is the belief] that He is the Creator of the servants' actions, both obediences and sins (1).
Another definition: It is Allah's estimation of things in eternity, His knowledge Almighty that they will occur at times known to Him and with specific attributes, His writing Almighty of that, His willing of it, and their occurrence according to how He estimated them and His creation of them (2).
All these definitions are close and include the four levels of Qadar: Knowledge, Writing, Will, and Creation.

The Difference between Qada and Qadar:
Sheikh Ibn Uthaymeen, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "Al-Qadar in language means: Estimation (Taqdir); Allah Almighty said: {Indeed, all things We created with predestination (49)} [Al-Qamar: 49], and He said: {So We determined, and excellent are the determiners (23)} [Al-Mursalat: 23].
- As for Al-Qada; in language it is: Judgment. Therefore, we say: Qada and Qadar are distinct if mentioned together, and synonymous if mentioned separately; according to the scholars' saying: They are two words: if they gather they separate (in meaning), and if they separate they gather (in meaning). So if it is said: This is Allah's Qadar; it includes Qada. But if they are mentioned together; each has a meaning.
- So Taqdir (Estimation): Is what Allah Almighty estimated in eternity to exist in His creation.
- As for Qada: It is what Allah Almighty decreed in His creation of bringing into existence, annihilation, or change. Based on this, Estimation (Taqdir) is preceding" (3).

text:
Section Two
The Importance of Belief in Destiny and Decree and Its Status in the Creed
Belief in Qadar is one of the fundamentals of faith without which a servant's faith is not complete. It is included in the belief in Allah Almighty, His Lordship, His Names, and His Attributes. For among His attributes, Almighty, are the attributes of Knowledge, Power, Will, and Creation, and it is known that Qadar relies on these foundations. There is no doubt that acknowledging the Oneness of Allah and His Lordship is not complete except by believing in His attributes Almighty. So whoever claims that there is a creator other than Allah Almighty has committed Shirk (polytheism), and Allah Almighty is the Creator of everything, and that includes the actions of the servants (1).
Explicit textual mention of the obligation of believing in Qadar did not appear in the Quran [as a pillar by name in a single list like the Hadith], but rather general evidences indicating Allah's estimation of things appeared (2), such as His saying Almighty: {Indeed, all things We created with predestination (49)} [Al-Qamar: 49], and His saying: {and created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination (2)} [Al-Furqan: 1-2], and His saying: {And the command of Allah is a decree determined (38)} [Al-Ahzab: 38], and His saying: {We placed it in a safe lodging (21) For a known term (22) So We determined, and excellent are the determiners (23)} [Al-Mursalat: 21-23].
Explicit mention of belief in Qadar came in the Sunnah, in the Hadith of Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, regarding Gabriel, peace be upon him, asking the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, about Faith. He said: «To believe in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, the Last Day, and to believe in Destiny (Al-Qadar), its good and its bad. He [Gabriel] said: You have spoken the truth» (3).
And on the authority of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «A servant does not believe until he believes in Destiny, its good and its bad from Allah, and until he knows that what hit him was not going to miss him, and what missed him was not going to hit him» (4).

Section Three: Evidences for Belief in Destiny and Decree from the Book and the Sunnah

First: Evidences from the Quran:
Allah Almighty said: {Indeed, all things We created with predestination (49)} [Al-Qamar: 49]. And He Almighty said: {and created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination (2)} [Al-Furqan: 1-2], (Meaning everything other than Him is created and nurtured, and He is the Creator of everything, its Lord, its King, and its God. Everything is under His subjugation, management, control, and determination) (1).
And He Almighty said: {And [remember, O Muhammad], when you said to the one on whom Allah bestowed favor and you bestowed favor, "Keep your wife and fear Allah," while you concealed within yourself that which Allah is to disclose. And you feared the people, while Allah has more right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had no longer any need for her, We married her to you in order that there not be upon the believers any discomfort concerning the wives of their adopted sons when they no longer have need of them. And ever is the command of Allah accomplished. (37) There is not to be upon the Prophet any discomfort concerning that which Allah has imposed upon him. [This is] the established way of Allah with those [prophets] who have passed on before. And ever is the command of Allah a decree determined (38)} [Al-Ahzab: 37-38], (Meaning His command which He decrees is inevitable and will occur, there is no way to avoid or divert it; whatever He wills happens, and whatever He does not will does not happen) (2).
And He Almighty said: {No disaster strikes except by permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah - He will guide his heart} [At-Taghabun: 11], (This is general for all calamities, in self, wealth, children, loved ones, and the like. So all that befalls the servants is by the Decree and Destiny of Allah; His knowledge has preceded it, His Pen has run with it, His Will has executed it, and His Wisdom has required it) (3).
And He Almighty said: {And We will make it black stubble. (5) We will make you recite, [O Muhammad], and you will not forget, (6) Except what Allah should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden. (7) And We will ease you toward ease. (8) So remind, if the reminder should benefit; (9) He who fears [Allah] will be reminded. (10)} [Al-A'la: 5-10]. Ibn Kathir said: (The verses in this meaning are many, indicating that Allah Almighty rewards the one who intends good with success in it, and the one who intends evil with abandonment, and all of that is by a destined decree) (4).

Second: Evidences from the Sunnah:
On the authority of Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, regarding Gabriel, peace be upon him, asking the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, about Faith. He said: «To believe in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, the Last Day, and to believe in Destiny (Al-Qadar), its good and its bad. He [Gabriel] said: You have spoken the truth» (1). (In this Hadith is that belief in Destiny is one of the six pillars of Faith mentioned. So whoever does not believe in Destiny, its good and its bad, has abandoned a fundamental of the religion and denied it, resembling those about whom Allah said: {So do you believe in part of the Scripture and disbelieve in part?} [Al-Baqarah: 85]) (2).
And on the authority of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «A servant does not believe until he believes in Destiny, its good and its bad from Allah, and until he knows that what hit him was not going to miss him, and what missed him was not going to hit him» (3).
Sheikh Ibn Baz, may Allah have mercy on him, said: (All the verses and hadiths mentioned in this chapter call the servant to believe that nothing will befall him except what Allah has written for him, and that what hit him was not going to miss him and what missed him was not going to hit him. They also call him to hasten to good deeds, compete in acts of obedience, be eager for causes of good, and stay away from causes of evil) (4).
And on the authority of Tawus, he said: I met people from the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, saying: Everything is by Destiny. He said: And I heard Abdullah bin Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, saying: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «Everything is by Destiny, even incapacity and shrewdness, or shrewdness and incapacity» (5).
And on the authority of Abu Darda, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: «No undutiful child, nor persistent drinker of alcohol, nor denier of Destiny enters Paradise» (6).
And on the authority of Ibn Al-Daylami, he said: I came to Ubayy bin Ka'b and said to him: Something regarding Destiny has occurred in my soul, so tell me something so that perhaps Allah Almighty removes it from my heart. He said: If Allah Almighty punished the inhabitants of His heavens and the inhabitants of His earth, He would punish them while He is not unjust to them. And if He had mercy on them, His mercy would be better for them than their deeds. And if you spent gold like Uhud in the path of Allah Almighty, Allah Almighty would not accept it from you until you believe in Destiny, and know that what hit you was not going to miss you, and what missed you was not going to hit you. And if you died on other than this, you would enter the Fire. He said: Then I came to Ibn Masud and he said the like of that. He said: Then I came to Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman and he said the like of that. He said: Then I came to Zaid bin Thabit and he narrated to me from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, the like of that (7).

Chapter Two: Levels of Destiny and Evidences for Each Level
Sheikh Al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah said: (The Saved Sect - Ahl al-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah - believes in Destiny, its good and its bad. Belief in Destiny is on two degrees, each degree includes two things:
The First Degree: Belief that Allah Almighty is All-Knowing of what creation will do, by His eternal Knowledge, with which He is described forever and ever. He knew all their states of obedience and disobedience, provisions and life spans. Then Allah wrote in the Preserved Tablet the destinies of creation...
Then he said: As for the Second Degree: It is the executable Will of Allah and His comprehensive Power. It is the belief that whatever Allah wills happens, and whatever He does not will does not happen. And that there is no movement or stillness in the heavens or on earth except by the Will of Allah Almighty. Nothing happens in His dominion which He does not want. And that He Almighty is capable of all things, existent and nonexistent. There is no creature on earth or in heaven except that Allah is its Creator, Glory be to Him, there is no creator other than Him, and no Lord besides Him) (1).
Based on this, the levels of Destiny are four, which are:

The First Level: Knowledge (Al-Ilm):
It is that Allah Almighty knew all things before their existence by His eternal Knowledge, and knew their measures, times, the life spans of servants, their provisions, and other than that. As He Almighty said: {Indeed, Allah is Knowing of all things (62)} [Al-Ankabut: 62]. And He Almighty said: {that you may know that Allah is over all things competent and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge (12)} [At-Talaq: 12], (Meaning to know the perfection of His Power and His encompassing of things, which is the meaning of {and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge}, so nothing of them exits His knowledge whatever it may be) (2).
And He Almighty said: {And with Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except Him. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but that He knows it. And no grain is there within the darknesses of the earth and no moist or dry [thing] but that it is [written] in a clear record} [Al-An'am: 59]. The keys of the unseen were interpreted by the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, as five things which no one knows except Allah, which are mentioned in His Almighty saying: {Indeed, Allah [alone] has knowledge of the Hour and sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted (34)} [Luqman: 34] (3).

And He Almighty said: {Your god is only Allah, except for whom there is no deity. He has encompassed all things in knowledge (98)} [Ta-Ha: 98] (Meaning He is Knowing of everything, He encompassed everything in knowledge, and counted everything in number. Not an atom's weight escapes Him in land or sea, nor does a leaf fall but that He knows it, nor a grain in the darknesses of the earth, nor anything moist or dry but that it is in a clear record {And there is no creature on earth but that upon Allah is its provision, and He knows its place of dwelling and place of storage. And on the authority of Imran bin Husain, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: A man said: O Messenger of Allah! Are the people of Paradise known from the people of the Fire? He said: «Yes», He said: So for what do the workers work? He said: «Everyone is facilitated for what he was created for» (2). Al-Bukhari titled a chapter on this saying: Chapter: The Pen has dried upon the Knowledge of Allah. And His saying: {And Allah left him astray based on knowledge}. (Iyad said: The meaning of 'the Pen dried' is that nothing is written after that, and the Book of Allah, His Tablet, and His Pen are from His Unseen and His Knowledge which we are obliged to believe in) (3).
And on the authority of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «No child is born but upon Fitrah (natural disposition). It is his parents who make him a Jew or a Christian, just as you help animals give birth, do you find among them a mutilated one until you mutilate them?» They said: O Messenger of Allah: What do you see about those who die while young? He said: «Allah knows best what they would have done» (4). The verses and hadiths in this meaning are many.

The Second Level: Writing (Al-Kitabah):
It is that Allah wrote all things of good and evil, obedience and disobedience, life spans and provisions, and other things. As He Almighty said: {Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah, is easy (70)} [Al-Hajj: 70], (He Almighty informs about the perfection of His knowledge of His creation and that He encompasses what is in the heavens and earth, so not an atom's weight escapes Him in the earth or in the sky, nor smaller than that nor larger, and that He Almighty knew the beings before their existence and wrote that in the Preserved Tablet) (5).

And He Almighty said: {No disaster strikes upon the earth or among yourselves except that it is in a register before We bring it into being - indeed that, for Allah, is easy (22)} [Al-Hadid: 22].
On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: «Allah wrote the destinies of creations fifty thousand years before He created the heavens and the earth. He said: And His Throne was upon the water» (1). (Scholars said: The intention is defining the time of writing in the Preserved Tablet or elsewhere, not the origin of estimation (Taqdir), for that is eternal with no beginning) (2).
In the two Sahihs from the Hadith of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: We were sitting with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and he had a stick with which he was scratching the ground. He lowered his head and said: «There is not one of you except that his seat from the Fire or from Paradise has been written.» A man from the people said: Should we not rely [on it], O Messenger of Allah? He said: «No, work, for everyone is facilitated. Then he recited {As for he who gives and fears Allah (5)} the verse [Al-Layl: 5]» (3). (This Hadith is a principle for Ahl al-Sunnah that happiness and misery are by the eternal decree of Allah. It contains a refutation of the Jabriyyah, because facilitation (Taysir) is the opposite of compulsion (Jabr), because compulsion only happens with dislike, and a human does not come to a thing by way of facilitation unless he is not disliking it) (4).

Types of Estimation (Taqdir) are five (1):

First: The General Estimation before the creation of the heavens and the earth: It is the Lord's estimation of all things, meaning His knowledge of them, writing of them, willing them, and creating whatever existed of them. Many evidences point to this type, including His saying Almighty: {Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah, is easy (70)} [Al-Hajj: 70], and His saying: {that you may know that Allah is over all things competent and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge (12)} [At-Talaq: 12], and His saying: {He does what He wills (18)} [Al-Hajj: 18], and His saying: {Allah is the Creator of all things} [Az-Zumar: 62]. And in Sahih Muslim from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «Allah estimated the destinies of creations fifty thousand years before He created the heaven and the earth, and His Throne was upon the water» (2).

Second: Writing of the Covenant (Mithaq) when He took from the Children of Adam while they were on the back of their father Adam: Allah Almighty said: {And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we have testified."} [Al-A'raf: 172]. In Musnad Imam Ahmad from Abu Darda, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: «Allah created Adam when He created him, then He struck his right shoulder and brought out offspring white like ants, and He struck his left shoulder and brought out offspring black like coal. He said to the ones in his right: To Paradise and I do not care, and He said to the ones in his left hand: To the Fire and I do not care» (3).

Third: The Lifetime Estimation (Al-Taqdir Al-Umri): It is the estimation of everything that happens to the servant in his life until the end of his term and writing his misery or happiness. The Hadith of Ibn Masud, may Allah be pleased with him, indicated this, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «Indeed, the creation of one of you is gathered in his mother's womb for forty days, then he is a clot like that, then he is a morsel like that, then Allah sends the angel and breathes the spirit into him and he is commanded with four words: to write his provision, his term, his deed, and whether he is miserable or happy...» (4) The Hadith.

This happens in Laylat al-Qadr (Night of Decree). His saying Almighty indicates it: {On that night is made distinct every precise matter (4)} [Ad-Dukhan: 4], and His saying Almighty: {The angels and the Spirit descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter (4) Peace it is until the emergence of dawn (5)} [Al-Qadr: 4-5]. It is said: In this night, what happens in the year of death, honor, humiliation, and other things is written. This was narrated from Ibn Umar, Mujahid, Abu Malik, Al-Dahhak, and others among the Predecessors (1).

Fifth: The Daily Estimation: His saying Almighty indicates it: {Every day He is in a matter} [Ar-Rahman: 29]. On the authority of Abu Darda, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, regarding the interpretation of {Every day He is in a matter}, he said: «From His matter is that He forgives a sin, relieves a distress, raises a people, and lowers others». Al-Bukhari recorded it as Mu'allaq (suspended) from Abu Darda as Mawquf (stopped) (2).

The Third Level: The Will (Al-Mashia):
Meaning that whatever Allah wills happens, and whatever He does not will does not happen. And that there is no movement or stillness in the heavens and earth except by His Will Almighty, and nothing happens in His dominion except what He wants. As He Almighty said: {To whoever wills among you to take a right course (28) And you do not will except that Allah wills - Lord of the worlds (29)} [At-Takwir: 28-29]. Ibn Kathir said: (Meaning the will is not entrusted to you, so whoever wishes is guided and whoever wishes goes astray, rather all that is subordinate to His Will Almighty, Lord of the Worlds) (3).
And He Almighty said: {Then whoever wills will remember it (55) And they will not remember except that Allah wills. He is worthy of fear and worthy to forgive (56)} [Al-Muddaththir: 55-56]. ({And they will not remember except that Allah wills} - For Allah's Will is executively general; neither little nor much event exits it. In it is a refutation of the Qadariyyah who do not include the actions of servants under Allah's Will, and the Jabriyyah who claim that the servant has no will nor action in reality, but is forced in his actions. So He Almighty affirmed for the servants a will in reality and action, and made that subordinate to His Will) (4).
And He Almighty said: {And if Allah had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and that which they invent (137)} [Al-An'am: 137]. Ibn Kathir said: (Meaning this happened by His Will Almighty, His Want, and His Choice for that to be, and He has the perfect wisdom in that, He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned) (5).

And on the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: «Indeed, the hearts of the children of Adam are all between two fingers of the fingers of the Most Merciful as one heart, He turns it how He wills.» Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «O Allah, Turner of the hearts, turn our hearts to Your obedience» (1). (The meaning of the Hadith is that He, Glory be to Him and Most High, disposes the hearts of His servants and others how He wills; nothing of them is impossible for Him, nor does what He wanted escape Him) (2).

The Fourth Level: Creation and Formation (Al-Khalq wa Al-Takwin):
It is that Allah Almighty is the Creator and Originator of all things, of essences, attributes, and actions, and that includes the actions of servants.
The evidences for this level are many, including His saying Almighty: {While Allah created you and that which you do (96)} [As-Saffat: 96], (Meaning He created you and created your actions) (3).
And He Almighty said: {Say, "Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Prevailing" (16)} [Ar-Ra'd: 16], (Al-Zajjaj said: And the meaning is that He is the Creator of everything that is valid to be created) (4).
And He Almighty said: {Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs (62)} [Az-Zumar: 62], (This phrase and similar ones, which are many in the Quran, indicate that all things - other than Allah and His Names and Attributes - are created) (5).

text:
Chapter Three: Schools of Thought of People in Destiny

Section One: The Cause of Disagreement in Destiny
(The disagreement in Destiny revolves around two matters: One: What relates to Allah Almighty, concerning the four levels of Destiny: Knowledge, Writing, Will, and Creation, which Ahl al-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah affirm for Allah Almighty. Second: What relates to the servant, does he have will and volition or not? Does he have power or not? Is he a doer of his action in reality or not?) (1).
The cause of the deviation of sects is their turning away from the Straight Path which Allah commanded us to follow, saying: {And, [moreover], this is My path, which is straight, so follow it; and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way} [Al-An'am: 153], and delving into the Action of the Lord with a cause (reason/why).
Sheikh Al-Islam said: And the root of the error of creation in every sect is delving into the act of the God with a cause (2). (For the Qadariyyah [Nufah - Negators] who denied Destiny said: Allah does not want disbelief, sins, and disobedience, nor does He love or approve of them, so how can we say He created the actions of servants which contain disbelief, sins, and disobedience? And the Qadariyyah Mujbirah [Compulsionists] believed that Allah is the Creator of everything, and claimed that everything He created and brought into existence, He loved and approved of. And Ahl al-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah saw the whole truth, so they believed in the truth that each of the two groups had, and negated the falsehood that each of them was clothed with. So they say: Allah, even if He wills disobedience by Destiny (Qadar), He does not love it, nor approve of it, nor command it; rather He hates it and forbids it) (3).

text:
Section Two: Schools of Thought of People in Destiny

First: The Jahmiyyah (1):
(They claimed that the generality of Allah's Will and the generality of His Volition imply: That the servant is forced in his actions, compelled and coerced in his sayings and deeds: he has no power over anything of obedience, nor over leaving disobedience) (2). (They say that servants are forced in their actions, having no power, will, or choice. And Allah alone is the Creator of servants' actions, and their deeds are attributed to them metaphorically) (3).

Second: The Mu'tazila (4):
They are Qadariyyah in the chapter of Destiny. The Qadariyyah (5) are divided into two sections:
First Qadariyyah: These are the extremists who denied Destiny and denied Allah's prior Knowledge of matters. (They say that Allah does not know the actions of servants before they do them, nor did Allah's Will attach to them. When the Muslims denounced them and declared them disbelievers for that: they shifted from their first saying and affirmed Knowledge but denied Destiny. Therefore, Imams like Imam Ahmad and others used to say: Debate the Qadariyyah with Knowledge; if they deny Knowledge, they have disbelieved, and if they admit it, they are defeated) (6).

He agreed with the Mu'tazila in negating eternal attributes and exceeded them in things. He claimed that Paradise and Hell will perish and vanish, and that Faith is knowledge of Allah only. (This sect which denies Allah's prior Knowledge has vanished or nearly so. Al-Saffarini says: Scholars said the deniers of this have become extinct, and they are the ones whom Imam Malik, Al-Shafi'i, Ahmad, and other Imams declared disbelievers because of it) (1).

Second Qadariyyah: They claimed (that the actions of servants, their obediences and disobediences, did not enter under Allah's Decree and Destiny. So they affirmed Allah's power over the essences of creatures and their descriptions, and denied His power over the actions of the accountable ones. They said: Allah did not want them nor will them from them, rather: they are the ones who wanted them, willed them, and did them, independently without Allah's Will) (2). (These say that the actions of servants are not created by Allah, but rather the servants are the creators of them. This is the school of the Mu'tazila and those who agreed with them. They deny the two levels of Will and Creation, negating them from Allah Almighty and affirming them for the human) (3).

Third: The Ash'aris (4):
These say: (Allah Almighty is the Creator of servants' actions, so they affirm the two levels of Will and Creation, but they say: The voluntary actions of servants occur by Allah Almighty's Power alone, and their [servants'] power has no effect on them. Rather, Allah Almighty made it His custom to create in the servant power and choice, so if there is no impediment, He creates His decreed action in him concurrently with them. So the action is created by Allah, originating and inventing, and acquired (Kasb) by the servant. The meaning of him acquiring it is: its concurrence with his power and will without there being any effect or entry from him in its existence other than being a locus for it) (5). Thus, they opposed the Mu'tazila who say that Allah does not create the actions of servants but rather they are the creators of them. But they said it is an Acquisition (Kasb) for the servants. (They wanted to reconcile between the Jabriyyah and the Qadariyyah, so they came with the theory of Kasb. In its outcome, it is pure Compulsion (Jabr), because it negates any power or influence for the servant. As for its theoretical philosophical reality, the Ash'aris themselves were unable to understand it, let alone explain it to others. For this reason, it was said: Among what is said but has no reasonable reality under it approaching understanding... is Kasb according to Al-Ash'ari, the State (Hal) according to Al-Bahshami, and the Leap (Tafra) of Al-Nazzam) (6).

text:
Fourth: Creed of Ahl al-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah:
Al-Tahawi, may Allah have mercy on him, explaining the creed of Ahl al-Sunnah said: (He created creation with His knowledge, determined for them destinies, set for them life spans. Nothing was hidden from Him before He created them, and He knew what they would do before He created them. He commanded them to obey Him and forbade them from disobeying Him. Everything runs according to His estimation and Will, and His Will is executed. Servants have no will except what He willed for them; so what He willed for them happened, and what He did not will did not happen. He guides whom He wills, protects and grants well-being out of grace; and He misguides whom He wills, forsakes and tests out of justice. All of them fluctuate in His Will between His grace and His justice. He is exalted above opposites and peers. There is no repeller of His decree, no adjuster of His judgment, and no one to overcome His command. We have believed in all of that, and are certain that all is from Him) (1).
Then he said: (And the Covenant which Allah Almighty took from Adam and his offspring is true. And Allah knew in pre-eternity the number of those who enter Paradise and the number of those who enter the Fire as a single total; that number is not increased nor decreased. Likewise their actions, [He knew] what He knew of them that they would do. Everyone is facilitated for what he was created for. Deeds are by their endings. The happy one is he who is happy by Allah's decree, and the miserable one is he who is miserable by Allah's decree. The principle of Destiny is Allah's secret in His creation; no drawn-near angel nor sent prophet has reviewed that. Delving deeply and looking into that is a means of forsakenness, a ladder to deprivation, and a degree of transgression. So beware, all beware of that in looking, thinking, and whispering. For Allah Almighty folded the knowledge of Destiny from His creatures, and forbade them from seeking it, as He Almighty said in His Book: {He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned (23)} [Al-Anbiya: 23]. So whoever asks: Why did He do? has rejected the judgment of the Book, and whoever rejects the judgment of the Book is among the disbelievers) (2).
Then he also said: (And we believe in the Tablet and the Pen, and in all that was inscribed in it. If all creation gathered on something Allah Almighty wrote in it that it would exist, to make it non-existent, they would not be able to. And if they gathered on something Allah Almighty did not write in it, to make it exist, they would not be able to. The Pen has dried with what will exist until the Day of Resurrection. What missed the servant was not going to hit him, and what hit him was not going to miss him. The servant must know that Allah's knowledge preceded in every being of His creation, so He estimated that with a firm, precise estimation. There is no nullifier for it, no adjuster, no remover, no changer, no diminisher, and no increaser from His creation in His heavens and earth. That is from the knot of Faith, the principles of Knowledge, and the acknowledgment of Allah Almighty's Oneness and Lordship, as He Almighty said in His Book: {and created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination (2)} [Al-Furqan: 2], and He Almighty said: {And ever is the command of Allah a decree determined (38)} [Al-Ahzab: 38]. So woe to whoever becomes an adversary to Allah Almighty in Destiny, bringing to look into it a sick heart. He has sought with his illusion in investigating the Unseen a concealed secret, and returned with what he said as a sinful liar) (3).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Destiny and Decree According to the Predecessors and Its Effect on the Believer
text:
Sheikh Al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah, may Allah have mercy on him, said: (The school of Ahl al-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah in this chapter and others is what the Book and Sunnah indicated, and what the First Predecessors of the Muhajireen and Ansar and those who followed them in goodness were upon. It is that Allah is the Creator of everything, its Lord and King. Included in that are all entities existing by themselves and their attributes existing in them, of servants' actions and other than servants' actions. And that He, Glory be to Him, whatever He willed happened, and whatever He did not will did not happen. Nothing exists in existence except by His Will and Power. Nothing He willed is impossible for Him; rather He is capable of all things, and He does not will a thing unless He is capable of it. And that He - Glory be to Him - knows what was, what is, and what did not happen, if it were to happen, how it would be. Included in that are the actions of servants and others. Allah estimated the destinies of creatures before creating them; He estimated their life spans, provisions, and deeds, and wrote that, and wrote what they will end up to of happiness and misery. So they believe in His creation of everything, His power over everything, His will for everything that happened, His knowledge of things before they are, His estimating of them, and His writing of them before they are) (1).
Until he said: (The predecessors of the Nation and its Imams are also agreed that servants are commanded with what Allah commanded them, forbidden from what He forbade them. And agreed on believing in His promise and threat which the Book and Sunnah spoke of. And agreed that no one has an argument against Allah in a duty left or a prohibition committed; rather Allah has the conclusive argument against His servants) (2).
He said: (Among what the predecessors of the Nation and its Imams agreed upon along with their belief in Destiny and Decree, and that Allah is the Creator of everything, and that whatever He willed happened and whatever He did not will did not happen, and that He misguides whom He wills and guides whom He wills, is that servants have will and power, doing by their will and power what Allah empowered them to do, along with their saying: Servants do not will except that Allah wills, as Allah Almighty said: {No! Indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder (54) Then whoever wills will remember it (55) And they will not remember except that Allah wills. He is worthy of fear and worthy to forgive (56)} [Al-Muddaththir: 54-56]) (3).
He also said: (The school of Ahl al-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah is that Allah Almighty is the Creator of everything and its King, there is no Lord other than Him and no Creator besides Him. Whatever He willed happened and whatever He did not will did not happen. He is over all things competent, and of all things Knowing. The servant is commanded to obey Allah and obey His Messenger, and forbidden from disobeying Allah and disobeying His Messenger. So whoever obeys, that is a blessing, and whoever disobeys is deserving of blame and punishment. Allah has the conclusive argument against him, and no one has an argument against Allah Almighty. All of that was by Allah's Decree, Destiny, Will, and Power. However, He loves obedience and commands it, rewards its people for doing it and honors them. And He hates disobedience and forbids it, and punishes its people and humiliates them.

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Destiny and Decree According to the Predecessors and Its Effect on the Believer
text:
Whatever befalls the servant of blessings, Allah bestowed them upon him. And whatever befalls him of evil is by his sins and disobedience as He Almighty said: {And whatever strikes you of disaster - it is for what your hands have earned} [Ash-Shura: 30] and He Almighty said: {What comes to you of good is from Allah, but what comes to you of evil, [O man], is from yourself} [An-Nisa: 79], meaning whatever comes to you of fertility, victory, and guidance, Allah bestowed it upon you, and whatever comes to you of sadness, humiliation, and evil is by your sins and errors. All things exist by Allah's Will, Power, and Creation. So the servant must believe in Allah's Decree and Destiny, and the servant must be certain of Allah's Law and Command. Whoever looks at the Truth of Destiny and turns away from Command, Prohibition, Promise, and Threat resembles the polytheists. And whoever looks at Command and Prohibition and denies Destiny and Decree resembles the Magians. And whoever believes in this and that, so if he does good he praises Allah Almighty, and if he does evil he asks forgiveness of Allah Almighty, and knows that is by Allah's Decree and Destiny, he is among the believers) (1).
Al-Qahtani, may Allah have mercy on him, said in his Nuniyyah:
The pillar of religion is to believe in Decree ... There is no good in a house without pillars
Allah knew happiness and misery ... And they and their status are opposites
The weak servant possesses no guidance for himself ... Nor is he capable of forsakenness
Glory be to Him who runs matters with wisdom ... In creation with provisions and deprivation
His Will was executed with His preceding knowledge ... In His creation, justly without aggression
And all is in the Mother of the Book inscribed ... Without negligence or decrease
So be moderate, you are guided, and do not be extremist ... Indeed pots overflow with boiling (2)

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Destiny and Decree According to the Predecessors and Its Effect on the Believer
text:
Chapter Four: Fruits of Belief in Destiny and Decree
Belief in Destiny in the correct manner yields majestic fruits that return to individuals and societies, in this world and the Hereafter. Among those fruits are the following:
1 - That Faith is not complete except by believing in Destiny: This fruit is the greatest of fruits, for the servant is not a believer until he believes in the six pillars of Faith, including belief in Destiny and Decree. On the authority of Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, regarding Gabriel, peace be upon him, asking the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, about Faith. He said: «To believe in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, the Last Day, and to believe in Destiny (Al-Qadar), its good and its bad. He [Gabriel] said: You have spoken the truth» (1).
And on the authority of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «A servant does not believe until he believes in Destiny, its good and its bad from Allah, and until he knows that what hit him was not going to miss him, and what missed him was not going to hit him» (2).
2 - Among the fruits of belief in Destiny: Complete faith prevents entering the Fire, and faith even if little prevents eternity in it (3): This is related to the fruit before it. If he realizes faith - and he cannot realize it except by believing in Destiny - that prevents him from entering the Fire. But if faith is deficient due to the weakness of his belief in Destiny, that deficiency might be a cause for his entering the Fire; but he will not stay eternally in it. Allah Almighty said: {They who believe and do not mix their belief with injustice - those will have security, and they are [rightly] guided (82)} [Al-An'am: 82].
3 - Among the fruits of belief in Destiny: Obtaining the taste of Faith, forgiveness of sins, and entering Paradise: No one will taste the flavor of Faith except the one who is pleased with Allah's destiny upon him. Therefore, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «He has tasted the flavor of Faith who is pleased with Allah as a Lord, Islam as a religion, and Muhammad as a Messenger» (4). Being pleased with that implies rejoicing in it, and happiness with Allah's Lordship and the goodness of His management and decrees upon him (5).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Destiny and Decree According to the Predecessors and Its Effect on the Believer
text:
Belief in Allah's Lordship also implies faith and submission to His management of every affair of the servant, and indeed the affairs of the entire universe. Whoever reaches this station of contentment deserves forgiveness, for the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, says: «Whoever says when he hears the Muazzin: 'And I testify that there is no god but Allah alone, with no partner, and I testify that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger, I am pleased with Allah as a Lord, with Muhammad as a Messenger, and with Islam as a religion,' his sin is forgiven» (1). Indeed, the effect of this extends to the Day of Resurrection, until it becomes a right upon Allah to please him and admit him to Paradise. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, says in what he narrates from his Lord: «My servant has no reward with Me when I take his beloved from the people of the world, then he seeks reward [for patience], except Paradise» (2).
4 - Among the fruits of belief in Destiny: Realizing Servitude (Ubudiyyah) to Allah Almighty: It is the goal for which the wayfarers strived, the intenders aimed, and the workers looked. So his eye finds comfort in his Lord, his heart dwells in Him, his limbs are reassured by Him, His remembrance takes over the tongue of His lover and his heart, and the limbs submit to His obedience (3). That is because he is a servant of Allah, nurtured by Him, He disposes of him however He wills. So he is pleased and submits to Allah's Decree and Destiny. He knows that Allah Almighty's withholding from His believing loving servant is giving, and His testing him is wellness. Sufyan Al-Thawri said: His withholding is giving, that is: He did not withhold out of miserliness or lack, but He looked at the good of His believing servant so He withheld from him by choice and good consideration. This is as he said; for Glory be to Him, He does not decree for His believing servant a decree except that it is good for him, whether that decree saddened him or pleased him. So His decree for His believing servant of withholding is giving; even if it is in the form of withholding. And a blessing even if it is in the form of an ordeal. And His trial is wellness; even if it is in the form of tribulation. But due to the servant's ignorance and injustice, he does not count giving, blessing, and wellness except what he finds pleasure in immediately, and was suitable for his nature. If he were granted a plentiful share of knowledge, he would count withholding as a blessing, and tribulation as mercy, and would enjoy tribulation more than his enjoyment of wellness, and enjoy poverty more than his enjoyment of wealth, and would be in the state of scarcity more grateful than in the state of abundance (4). And he would be like the Bedouin who woke up having lost many camels, so he said:
No, by the One whom I am a servant in His worship ... Were it not for the gloating of enemies with grudges
I would not have been pleased that my camels were in their resting places ... And that something Allah decreed had not happened (5)

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Destiny and Decree According to the Predecessors and Its Effect on the Believer
text:
Ibn al-Qayyim said: (To Allah, Glory be to Him, upon His servant is a command He commanded him with, a decree He decrees upon him, and a blessing He bestows upon him. He is never separated from these three. The decree is of two types: either calamities or defects/sins. And He has upon him servitude in all these levels. The most beloved of creation to Him is he who knows his servitude in these levels and fulfills its right; this one is the closest of creation to Him. And the furthest of them from Him is he who is ignorant of his servitude in all these levels. So his servitude in the Command is: his compliance, sincerely and following the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. And in the Prohibition: avoiding it, out of fear of Him, reverence, and love. And his servitude in the decree of Calamities is: Patience over them, then Contentment (Rida) with them, which is higher than it, then Gratitude for them, which is higher than Contentment. This is only possible if His love is established in his heart, and he knows His good choice for him, His kindness to him, His gentleness with him, and His benevolence to him through the calamity, even if he hates the calamity. And his servitude in the decree of Defects/Sins is: Hastening to repent from them, clearing oneself, and standing in the station of apology and brokenness, knowing that no one lifts them but Him, and no one protects from their evil but Him. And that if they continue, they distance him from His proximity, and expel him from His door. So he sees them as the harm that no one uncovers but Him, until he sees them as greater than the harm of the body... As for the servitude of Blessings, it is knowing them and acknowledging them first, then seeking refuge in Him lest his heart attributes and ascribes them to other than Him; even if it is a cause among causes, He is its Causer and Establisher. So the blessing is from Him alone in every aspect and consideration, then praising Him for it, loving Him for it, and thanking Him by using it in His obedience) (1).
In belief in Destiny is: Acknowledging that he is nurtured, managed, commanded, forbidden; he only acts by the ruling of Servitude, not by the ruling of choice for himself. Allah Almighty is the One disposing of him; his soul is in the hand of his Lord and Master, his forelock is in His hand, his heart is between two fingers of His fingers. His death, life, happiness, misery, wellness, and trial are all to Him, Glory be to Him; the servant has nothing of it. He is a servant of Allah in all aspects, small and big, alive and dead, obedient and disobedient, healthy and afflicted, with spirit, heart, tongue, and limbs (2).
foot_note:
1. Al-Fawaid p. 46 - 47, arrangement and commentary by Ali Hasan Abdul Hamid, Dar Ibn Al-Jawzi, Dammam, 1417 AH.
2. Al-Fawaid p. 50 - 52.

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Destiny and Decree According to the Predecessors and Its Effect on the Believer
text:
5 - Among the fruits of belief in Destiny: That belief in Destiny is a path to the Tawhid (Monotheism) of Allah: (It is to witness the singling out of the Lord Blessed and Exalted in Creation and Judgment, and that whatever He willed happened and whatever He did not will did not happen, and that no atom moves except by His permission. And that creatures are subjugated under His grip, and that there is no heart except that it is between two fingers of His fingers. If He wills to set it right He sets it right, and if He wills to deviate it He deviates it. Hearts are in His hand. He is their Turner and Disposer how He wills and how He wants. And that He is the One who gave the souls of believers their piety, and He is the One who guided and purified them, and inspired the souls of the wicked and made them miserable. Whom Allah guides there is no misleader for him, and whom He misguides there is no guide for him. He guides whom He wills by His bounty and mercy, and misguides whom He wills by His justice and wisdom. This is His bounty and giving, and the bounty of the Generous is not with obligation [from recipient]. And this is His justice and decree {He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned (23)} [Al-Anbiya: 23]) (1).
(By this, the servant realizes the station of {It is You we worship and You we ask for help (5)} in knowledge and state. The servant's foot becomes firm in Tawhid of Lordship, then he ascends from it to Tawhid of Divinity. For if he becomes certain that harm and benefit, giving and withholding, guidance and misguidance, happiness and misery: all that is in the hand of Allah not in the hand of anyone else, and that He is the One who turns hearts and disposes them how He wills, and that there is no successful one except whom He granted success and helped, and no forsaken one except whom He forsook, humiliated and abandoned. And that the healthiest of hearts, the soundest, most upright, thinnest, purest, strongest and softest of them: is the one who took Him alone as God and Object of Worship. So He was more beloved to him than anything else, more feared by him than anything else, and more hoped for by him than anything else. So His love advances in his heart over all loves, so loves follow it just as the army follows the Sultan. And fear of Him advances in his heart over all fears, so all fears follow His fear. And hope in Him advances in his heart over all hopes, so every hope follows His hope. This is the sign of Tawhid of Divinity in this heart, and the door from which he entered to it is Tawhid of Lordship. Meaning the door of Tawhid of Divinity: is Tawhid of Lordship) (2).
6 - Among the fruits of belief in Destiny: Worshipping Allah through His Names and Attributes: It is knowing the connection of existence, in creation and command, to the Beautiful Names and Lofty Attributes, and its link to them, and that the world - with what is in it - is from some of their traces and requirements (3). For among His names, Glory be to Him, are "The Perpetual Forgiver (Al-Ghaffar), The Accepter of Repentance (Al-Tawwab), The Pardoner (Al-Afuw)". These names must have attachments. There must be a crime to be forgiven, a repentance to be accepted, and offenses to be pardoned. And there must be for His name "The Wise (Al-Hakim)" an attachment that appears in His judgment. Since the requirement of these names for their traces is like the requirement of the name "The Creator, The Provider, The Giver, The Withholder" for the created, the provided, the given, and the withheld. And these names are all beautiful.

3. Previous Reference (1/ 417).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Destiny and Decree According to the Predecessors and Its Effect on the Believer
text:
The Lord Almighty loves His Essence, His Attributes, and His Names. He is Pardoning who loves pardoning, loves forgiveness, and loves repentance. He rejoices over the repentance of His servant when he repents to Him with the greatest joy imaginable. The decreeing of what He forgives and pardons its doer for, and is forbearing towards, and accepts repentance for and tolerates: is from the requirement of His names and attributes, and the achievement of what He loves and is pleased with from that. And what He praises Himself with and the inhabitants of His heavens and earth praise Him with: is from the requirements of His perfection and the implication of His praise. He, Glory be to Him, is the Praiseworthy, the Glorious; and His Praise and Glory require their traces. From their traces: forgiving slips, cancelling stumbles, pardoning bad deeds, and tolerating crimes, along with complete power to exact the right, and knowledge from Him, Glory be to Him, of the crime and the amount of its punishment. So His forbearance is after His knowledge, His pardon is after His power, and His forgiveness is from the perfection of His might and wisdom. As the Messiah, peace be upon him, said: {If You should punish them - indeed they are Your servants; but if You forgive them - indeed it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise (118)} [Al-Ma'idah: 118]. Meaning: Your forgiveness is out of the perfection of Your power and wisdom. You are not like one who forgives out of incapacity, and tolerates out of ignorance of the extent of the right. Rather, You are knowing of Your right, capable of exacting it, wise in taking it.
From His names is The Wise (Al-Hakim). So he witnesses Allah's wisdom in His decreeing upon His servant what He hates and dislikes, Glory be to Him, and blames and punishes for. And that if He willed, He would have protected him from it, and intervened between him and it. And that He, Glory be to Him, is not disobeyed by force. And that nothing exists in the world except by His Will {Unquestionably, His is the creation and the command; blessed is Allah, Lord of the worlds (54) Call upon} [Al-A'raf: 54]. These witness that Allah, Glory be to Him, did not create anything in vain or pointlessly, and that He has profound wisdom in everything He estimated and decreed of good and evil, obedience and disobedience. A dazzling wisdom that minds are unable to encompass its essence, and tongues are weary of expressing. So the source of His decree and destiny, for what He hates and is displeased with: is His name "The Wise" whose wisdom dazzled the intellects. Allah Almighty said to His angels - when they said {Will You place upon it one who causes corruption therein and sheds blood, while we declare Your praise and sanctify You?} He answered them Glory be to Him saying {Indeed, I know that which you do not know (30)} [Al-Baqarah: 30]. For Allah, Glory be to Him, in the appearance of disobedience, sins, and crimes, and the resulting traces of signs and wisdoms, and types of introductions to His creation, diversifying His signs, and evidences of His Lordship, Oneness, Divinity, Wisdom, Might, completeness of His Dominion, perfection of His Power, and encompassing of His Knowledge -: has what people of insight witness clearly with the insight of their hearts, saying {Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You} [Ali Imran: 191], it is but Your dazzling wisdom and Your apparent signs.
foot_note: None

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Divine Decree and Predestination according to the Salaf and its Effect on the Believer
text:
And in every movement and stillness, He has a witness forever ... And in everything, He has a sign indicating that He is One (1). So whoever contemplates the flow of the effects of the Names and Attributes in the world and in the command, it becomes clear to him that the source of the decree of these crimes from the servants and their predestination is from the perfection of the Names, Attributes, and Actions. And their ends also: are the requirement of His praise and glory, just as it is the requirement of His Lordship and Divinity. For Him in everything He decreed and predestined is profound wisdom, dazzling signs, making Himself known to His servants through His Names and Attributes, inviting their love for Him, their remembrance of Him, their gratitude to Him, and their worship of Him through His beautiful Names (2).
7 - Among the fruits of belief in Predestination: The realization of the Wala' (friendship/alliance) of Allah Almighty. Allah Almighty says: {Unquestionably, [for] the allies of Allah there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve (62) Those who believed and were fearing Allah (63)} [Yunus: 62-63] (3). And among the matters that must be believed in is belief in Predestination; so if one does not believe in Predestination, he is not among the allies of Allah.
8 - Among the fruits of belief in Predestination: That Allah defends those who believe. Allah Almighty says: {Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed} [Al-Hajj: 38]. He defends them against dislikes before they descend, and lifts them or lightens them after they descend (4). This is only for the believers, and among what they believe in is belief in Predestination.
9 - Among the fruits of belief in Predestination: Allah's pleasure with him. For whoever is pleased with Allah as Lord, Allah is pleased with him. And whoever is pleased with his Lord, Glory be to Him, in all conditions, it bears fruit in his Lord's pleasure with him: If he is pleased with Him regarding little provision: his Lord is pleased with him regarding little deed. And if he is pleased with Him in all conditions, and they are equal to him, he finds Him the quickest thing to His pleasure if he seeks to please Him and courts Him (5).
10 - Among the fruits of belief in Predestination: That it bequeaths the love of Allah Almighty for His servant. And there is no doubt that this is the highest of demands and the highest wish, that the servant attains the love of Allah, Blessed and Exalted is He, for him. Allah Almighty says addressing His Prophet, peace be upon him: {And when you have decided, then rely upon Allah. Indeed, Allah loves those who rely [upon Him] (159)} [Ali 'Imran: 159]. They are those pleased with His decree and submissive to His judgment regarding them, whether that agrees with their desire or opposes it (6). He, peace be upon him, said: "If Allah loves a people, He tests them" (7).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Divine Decree and Predestination according to the Salaf and its Effect on the Believer
text:
11 - Among the fruits of belief in Predestination: Trust in Allah Almighty. Because the believer in Allah's decree and predestination knows that Allah's decree for him contains good. Allah Almighty said to the mother of Moses: {And when you fear for him, cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve} [Al-Qasas: 7]. Her doing this is the essence of her trust in Allah Almighty, for had it not been for her complete trust in her Lord, she would not have cast her child and the piece of her liver into the current of water, with its waves and currents playing with him to wherever it ends or stops (1).
12 - Among the fruits of belief in Predestination: Submission (Taslim), and it is of two types: submission to His religious command ruling, and submission to His cosmic predestined ruling. As for the first: it is the submission of the knowing believers. Allah Almighty says: {But no, by your Lord, they will not [truly] believe until they make you, [O Muhammad], judge concerning that over which they dispute among themselves and then find within themselves no discomfort from what you have judged and submit in [full, willing] submission (65)} [Al-Nisa: 65]. As for the second: it is submission to the cosmic ruling, which is the issue of being pleased with the decree. It is praiseworthy if the servant is not commanded to dispute and repel it, and is unable to do so, like calamities which he has no power to repel. As for the rulings which he is commanded to repel: it is not permissible for him to submit to them; rather, servitude is: repelling them with other rulings more beloved to Allah than them (2). The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was affected by the loss of his son Ibrahim, but he said: "The eye tears and the heart grieves, and we do not say except what pleases our Lord, and indeed we are grieved by your separation, O Ibrahim" (3). So submission is freedom from the doubt of contradicting the report, or the desire of contradicting the command, or the will of contradicting sincerity, or an objection contradicting Predestination and Sharia. And the owner of this freedom: is the owner of the sound heart, whom none will be saved on the Day of Resurrection except the one who comes to Allah with it, for submission is the opposite of disputing (4).

2. Madarij Al-Salikin (2/146).
3. Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Book of Funerals, Chapter: The saying of the Prophet peace be upon him "Indeed we are grieved by you" (3/172 - Fath Al-Bari).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in Divine Decree and Predestination according to the Salaf and its Effect on the Believer
text:
13 - Belief in Predestination in the true sense reveals to a person the wisdom of Allah Almighty in what He decrees of good or evil. Thus, a person knows by that that behind his thinking and imaginations is One who is Greater and More Knowledgeable. Therefore, how often does a thing happen and we dislike it while it is good for us? How many people become annoyed and their chests tighten due to missing a beloved thing or the occurrence of a distress, and as soon as the matter unfolds and the secret of Predestination becomes clear, you find him joyful and happy, because the outcome was praiseworthy for him. And Allah Almighty spoke the truth when He says: {But perhaps you hate a thing and it is good for you; and perhaps you love a thing and it is bad for you. And Allah Knows, while you know not (216)} [Al-Baqarah: 216]. How beautiful is the saying of the one who said: How many a blessing whose thanks cannot be borne ... for Allah is hidden within the folds of dislikes. And the saying of the other: Matters run according to the judgment of Decree ... And within the folds of events are beloved and disliked things. Perhaps what I was warning against pleased me ... And perhaps what I was hoping for saddened me (1).
14 - Among the fruits of belief in Predestination: That belief in Predestination opens the door of good character with Allah Almighty and with people. For good character comes from satisfaction, and bad character comes from discontent. Good character raises its owner to the degree of the one who fasts and stands in prayer, and bad character consumes good deeds just as fire consumes wood (2).
15 - Among the fruits of belief in Predestination: Thinking well of Allah, and strength of hope: The believer in Predestination thinks well of Allah and has strong hope in Him in all his states. The saying of the poet applies to him: No decree touched me with harm or pleasure ... Except that I found a path to You through it. (Because he is knowledgeable of his Lord, thinking well of Him, not accusing Him regarding what He brings upon him of His judgments and decrees. So his good thought of Him necessitates the equality of states for him and his satisfaction with what his Master, Glory be to Him, chooses for him. And bad state and thinking [ill] of Allah is contrary to what He deserves. Satisfaction saves him from all that and opens for him the door of the paradise of this world before the paradise of the Hereafter) (3).
foot_note:
1. See: Jannat Al-Rida fi Al-Taslim Lima Qaddara Allah wa Qada by Al-Gharnati p. 3/52, quoted from Al-Qada' wa Al-Qadar by Al-Hamad p. 29.
